meanings.definition: To make someone feel nervous or frightened.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunder unnerves my little sister.
meanings.sent2: The dark forest unnerves me when I walk through it alone.
meanings.sent3: The spooky movie unnerves the audience, but they still enjoy it.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence unnerves me more than any noise.
meanings.sent5: The sudden scream unnerves everyone in the haunted house.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to lose confidence or courage.
meanings.sent1: The harsh criticism unnerves the young actor before his performance.
meanings.sent2: The failure unnerves him, but he tries again with determination.
meanings.sent3: The teasing unnerves him, but he knows his friends mean well.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected challenge unnerves her, but she faces it bravely.
meanings.sent5: The rejection letter unnerves him momentarily, but he quickly regains his confidence.
